instruction: Can you tell me how to format an url in rst?
output:
In reStructuredText (RST), you can use the `url` role to format a URL. Here's an example:

```rst
The Python programming language is available at:

.. url:: https://www.python.org/
```

This will create a clickable link to the Python website in the output. You can also use the `raw` role to include a URL without making it clickable:

```rst
The Python programming language is available at:

.. raw:: https://www.python.org/
```

This will display the URL as plain text in the output.

You can also use the `link` directive to define a custom link:

```rst
The Python programming language is available at:

.. link:: https://www.python.org/
```

This will create a clickable link to the Python website in the output. You can use the `link` directive to define other types of links as well, such as email addresses or local files.

For more information, you can refer to the reStructuredText documentation:

* [reStructuredText Markup Language Specification](https://docutils.sourceforge.io/rst.html#url-roles)
* [reStructuredText Markup Language Specification - Links](https://docutils.sourceforge.io/rst.html#link-directive)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
